assignments.name: Discussion Forums
assignments.description: Students will explore topics through online discussions. Each discussion will be initiated with a framing post and questions. Students will respond to the questions and comment critically on other posts.

assignments.name: Individual Homework
assignments.description: To help reinforce the material covered in the modules, homework assignments will be assigned. The homework will include questions and problems related to the course materials and the development of simple models and simulations.

assignments.name: Modeling and Simulation Article Review
assignments.description: Each student will complete a review of a modeling and simulation journal article highlighting one of the modeling and simulation approaches.

assignments.name: Class Project
assignments.description: The class project will assess the learning from all modules. The student group will address a problem of their choosing.

assignments.name: Project Related Homework
assignments.description: Throughout the course, the student groups will complete parts of the project as homework assignments.

assignments.name: Final Project Presentation and Report
assignments.description: At the conclusion of the project, a report will be prepared by the student groups to summarize their work.

_metadata.course_description: This course emphasizes the development of modeling and simulation concepts and analysis skills necessary to design, program, implement, and use computers to solve complex systems/products analysis problems.
learning_outcomes: Examine classic and modern (state-of-the-art) modeling and simulation methods and techniques.
Analyze socio-technical challenges and problems to determine appropriate modeling techniques.
Apply the methods, processes, and tools needed to perform effective and efficient modeling and simulation on complex projects/programs.
Conduct analysis of real-world data and complex problems.
Describe the role of modeling and simulation within the systems engineering and the system development lifecycle.
prerequisites: Graduate Status or approved by advisor and instructor
